macrosData.myMacros: Total Daily Caloric Intake: ~2100-2300 calories. Proteins: 150 g - 200 g (600 - 800 calories). This is crucial for muscle recovery and growth. Fats: 70 g - 92 g (630 - 830kcal). Healthy fats help with metabolism and hormone production. Carbohydrates: 195 g - 275 g (780 - 1100 calories). Carbs provide energy for your workouts and daily activities.

mealPlanData.myMealPlans: Based on the information you provided and considering a standard macronutrient distribution of 40% Protein, 30% Carbohydrate, and 30% Fat, here is a meal plan for you to maintain your weight: **Monday:** - Breakfast: 1 serving of scrambled eggs (2 eggs) with 1 small avocado and 2 slices of whole wheat toast. - Lunch: 1 serving of quinoa salad with grilled chicken (4oz), cherry tomatoes, cucumber and a light vinaigrette. - Dinner: 1 serving of baked salmon (4oz) with roasted sweet potato (1 cup) and steamed broccoli (1 cup). - Snacks: 1 medium apple and 10 raw almonds. **Tuesday:** - Breakfast: 1 cup of Greek yogurt with 1/2 cup mixed berries and a tablespoon of honey. - Lunch: 1 serving of grilled turkey sandwich with whole grain bread and a side salad. - Dinner: 1 serving of grilled shrimp (4oz) with a 1 cup quinoa and grilled vegetables. - Snacks: 1 banana and 1 oz of mixed nuts. **Wednesday:** - Breakfast: 2 whole grain pancakes with a tablespoon of peanut butter and 1 sliced banana. - Lunch: 1 serving of grilled chicken salad with assorted vegetables and light dressing. - Dinner: 1 serving of roasted chicken breast (4oz) with 1 cup of mashed sweet potatoes and mixed steamed vegetables. - Snacks: Greek yogurt with fresh berries. **Thursday:** - Breakfast: 1 serving of vegetable omelet with 2 slices of whole wheat bread.- Lunch: 1 serving of tuna salad with light mayo on whole grain bread, and a side salad. - Dinner: 1 serving of pork tenderloin (4oz) with 1 cup brown rice and roasted vegetables. - Snacks: 1 cup of sliced fruit (apples/pears/banana). **Friday:** - Breakfast: 1 serving of oatmeal (1/2 cup dry oats) cooked in almond milk, with 1/2 sliced banana and a spoonful of almond butter.- Lunch: 1 serving of grilled chicken wrap with whole grain tortilla and a side salad. - Dinner: 1 serving of seared salmon (4oz) with 1 cup quinoa and mixed steamed vegetables. - Snacks: 1 small yogurt with a handful of blueberries. **Saturday:** - Breakfast: 2 scrambled eggs with 1 cup of cooked spinach and a slice of whole wheat toast. - Lunch: 1 serving of turkey and cheese sandwich on whole grain bread with a side of veggies. - Dinner: 1 serving of shrimp stir fry with 1 cup of brown rice. - Snacks: 1 fresh fruit and a handful of nuts. **Sunday:** - Breakfast: 1 serving of protein smoothie (1 scoop of protein powder, 1 banana, spinach, almond milk). - Lunch: 1 serving of chicken salad with a mix of your favorite veggies and vinaigrette.- Dinner: 1 serving of grilled steak (4oz) with 1 cup of sweet potato and steamed asparagus. - Snacks: Greek yogurt with fresh mixed berries.

workoutData.myWorkouts: Based on your age, gender, weight, and height, with a fitness goal of maintaining your weight and a moderate-high exercise level, I suggest something along these lines:- Day 1: Upper body and core strength exercises - Warm Up: 10 minutes of light cardio (jogging, jump roping, or cycling) - Exercises: - 3 sets of 10 reps each of push ups - 3 sets of 15 reps each of dumbbell rows - 3 sets of 10 reps of overhead tricep extensions - 3 sets of 15 reps of abdominal crunches - 3 sets of 15 reps of plank shoulder taps - Cool Down: 10 minutes of stretching, focusing on the upper body and core area Day 2: Lower body and core strength exercises - Warm Up: 10 minutes of light cardio (jumping jacks, high knees, or mountain climbers) - Exercises: - 3 sets of 10 reps each of squats - 3 sets of 10 reps each of lunges (per leg) - 3 sets of 15 reps of glute bridges - 3 sets of 10 reps of calf raises - 3 sets of 20 reps of bicycle crunches - Cool Down: 10 minutes of stretching, focusing on the lower body and core area Day 3: Cardiovascular exercise - Warm Up: 10 minutes of light jogging and dynamic stretching - Main Exercise: 30 to 45 minutes of moderate-intensity cardio of your choice (running, swimming, cycling, etc.) - Cool Down: 10 minutes of light walking and stretching Day 4: Rest Day Day 5: Total body strength exercises - Warm Up: 10 minutes of light cardio like skipping, walking, or light cycling - Exercises: - 3 sets of 8 reps of kettlebell swings - 3 sets of 10 reps each of burpees - 3 sets of 10 reps of deadlifts - 3 sets of 10 reps of overhead press - Cool Down: 10 minutes of full body stretching Day 6: Cardiovascular exercise - Warm Up: 10 minutes of light jogging and dynamic stretching - Main Exercise: 30 to 45 minutes of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) - Cool Down: 10 minutes of light walking and deep breathing Day 7: Rest Day
